Key Match Events: Sorba Thomas had a goal disallowed as the Dragons impressed in Craig Bellamy’s debut as head coach
Baris Yilmaz collected a second yellow card and Turkey went down to 10 men
Bellamy made substitutions to try and keep the energy levels high, but Wales couldn’t break the deadlock
Pre-Game Insights: Craig Bellamy’s first match in charge of the Welsh national team was an exciting and promising affair that displayed how he wants them to play going forward
Bellamy has used his first training sessions with the squad to implement a progressive new style of play
Bellamy hoping to introduce new style of play
Post-Match Reflections: Not the result the Welsh fans wanted but they were encouraged by the performance
Bellamy has Wales playing exciting football
Miscellaneous Highlights: Wales 0-0 Turkey: The match was also the first game in charge for new manager Craig Bellamy who was appointed in July
The match was played at the Cardiff City Stadium in Cardiff, Wales
Others: Wales’ early team news: Craig Bellamy’s first Wales squad features many of the names that fans have become used to seeing
Turkey early team news: The Turkey squad is much the same as it was during Euro 2024
